Build. Serve. Innovate.

Empowering Youth to Build — and Uplift — Humanity

Project Humanity empowers the next generation by equipping young minds with impactful STEM and innovation skills. Through hands-on learning in CAD design, 3D printing, and medically inspired research projects, we inspire creativity, problem-solving, and a spirit of service—preparing youth to use technology not just to build, but to uplift humanity.

Join the Movement Explore Programs
  • CAD + 3D Design to Prototype
  • Med Outreach Senior Wellness Visits
  • Service Local Impact Projects

What We Do

Hands-on pathways in design, fabrication, and community health that turn curiosity into impact.

STEM Project

CAD & 3D Printing

Students learn design thinking with CAD (Onshape) and bring ideas to life on 3D printers. From functional gadgets to community prototypes, youth develop skills in modeling, iteration, and real-world problem solving.

  • Beginner-friendly CAD modules in Onshape
  • Print safety, slicing basics, and materials overview
  • Team challenges that solve real community needs
Med Project

Health Literacy & Service

Inspired by public health, teams visit local senior centers to share practical steps for slowing the progression of chronic illnesses through lifestyle and routine care awareness. Students practice empathy, communication, and evidence-based outreach.

  • Age-friendly presentations & handouts
  • Wellness trackers and simple screening literacy
  • Service hours with measurable community outcomes

Fundraiser: Diwali Mela

Heritage Park • Flower Mound, Texas

Celebrate light, culture, and community while supporting youth STEM education! Visit our booth at the Diwali Mela to see student-made 3D prints, learn about our outreach to senior centers, and help fund printers, materials, and scholarship seats for underserved students.

  • Live demos: CAD to 3D print
  • Student project showcase
  • Donation & volunteer sign-ups
Pledge Support Ask a Question

Get Involved

We’re opening new cohorts for design, 3D printing, and community health outreach. Students, parents, mentors, and sponsors are welcome—bring your curiosity, we’ll bring the tools.
